page.title: 15COUNTRY SPORTS - VIEW 1
page.content:
Many local farmers are keen members of the Meynell and South Staffordshire Hunt and preserve copses and woods to provide cover for the fox, at the same time providing homes for wild animals and birds. It is great to see hounds working, following the scent of the fox, and one hopes for a good chase over a few fences in pursuit of Charlie. It is a good sport, as he is either caught and killed instantly, or he gets clean away.
Many estates employ gamekeepers to raise pheasants and partridges, and then organised shoots take place. Well trained retriever dogs fetch the shot birds back for their owners. Adults and children belong to clubs and fish the many small pools, often using the new type of weights which are harmless to birds.
